name: IKEA VR Experience
description: Explore and interact with an IKEA Kitchen in Virtual Reality! Walk around freely, open drawers and put your vegetable peelings in the waste sorting station. You can even enjoy the visual impact of different material finishes and experience things from a childâ€™s point of view.
minimum_requirements: OS: Windows 7 or higher Processor: Intel(R) Core(TM) i7 -4790K CPU @ 4.00GHz Memory: 16 GB RAM Graphics: GeForce GTX 980 or equal Storage: 2 GB available space Sound Card: Yes Additional Notes: HTC Vive VR headset with two working handcontrollers

reviews.review_text: I played this just to steal the pencils
I was disappointed to not find the Ikea playground. Edit: I finally found it, I only had to go outside.

Cool proof of concept, limited at the moment, but will be awesome once you can build your own kitchens or interact with a variety of environments. I really like the idea of an interactive VR IKEA brochure.  And now you can try cooking the meatballs, which is a nice bonus :) (although my wife just trashed the joint, covering the floor in meatballs and pots.)
The only way my husband can tell me to get back to the kitchen without getting slapped
Legit though my friend was more intrested in this than any of my other vive games

Hey! It's a thing! It's free. There are a few little things to play with, and if you're actually interested in looking at different furniture, than maybe you would be interested. Download it while you're sleeping, and play around in this experience. It's worth your time, even if you just want to spend 10 minutes in it and delete it. It's an interesting look into how VR can go beyond just gaming and perhaps into other areas, with a well polished look and set of interactions.

I'm surprised I didn't have to assemble my Vive headset before being allowed to run this game. Surprisingly good immersion, though I think the experience would be much improved if you were able to 'accidentally' start a small kitchen fire that got out of control. Would cook my balls again though, meatballs that is.
I wanted to Ikea so I Ikea'd. No regrets.
Within the first 30 seconds I was so immersed I tried to place my controllers on the sideboard. Also you don't need room-scale to play this. Its not much of a game, but it is a cool experience
Finally you can buy meatballs with your own steam wallet and of course you can steal all those pencils!

Okay, now I understnad that this is called IKEA VR Experience, so I probably shouldn't have expected much. However, I wished there was more than what truly is in this. I thought that in this game you would be able to like maybe decorate a room using ikea furniture, or even possibly getting to build it or something besides this. I mean I guess it's 'okay' but this is more like a one time play, so at least it's free. But all you get to do really is walk around a kitchen filled with what I'm assuming IKEA furniture, and change one or two things in there, but that's all. So if you're expectations were the same as mine, and you also don't mind paying for a game, I would go ahead and get Home Improvisation: Furniture Sandbox. But side note to the creators: if you want this game to go more, maybe you should take some notes from the other game I mentioned and other furniture simulators. Please don't be offended, just trying to help.

Loaded this up with the gf. Was hoping it would have a bit more content. It only has one room and you can do everything there is to do in under 10 minutes (as advertised). That said, It's reasonably well made and it IS free so I gave it a thumbs up.
